text: Erigeron asperugineus (Idaho fleabane) is a species of fleabane in the daisy family. It is native to the western United States, the states of Montana, Idaho, Utah, and Nevada.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Erigeron asperugineus is a small perennial herb up to 20 cm (8 inches) tall. One plant usually produces 1 or 2 flower heads, each with 10–25 blue, pink, or purple ray florets surrounding many yellow disc florets.Flora of North America, Erigeron asperugineus (D. C. Eaton) A. Gray, Notes Compositae. 91. 1880. Idaho fleabane ==References== asperugineus Category:Flora of the Western United States Category:Plants described in 1871
title: Erigeron asperugineus
